verses.kjv: Then the LORD said unto Moses, Now shalt thou see what I will do to Pharaoh: for with a strong hand shall he let them go, and with a strong hand shall he drive them out of his land.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Now you shall see what I will do to Pharaoh, for by a strong hand he shall let them go, and by a strong hand he shall drive them out of his land.”
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses, "Now you'll see what I'm going to do to Pharaoh. My powerful hand will force him to let my people go — in fact, he'll be so eager to get rid of them that he'll drive them out of his land himself."

verses.kjv: And God spake unto Moses, and said unto him, I am the LORD:
verses.web: God spoke to Moses, and said to him, “I am LORD.
verses.ct: God spoke to Moses and told him, "I am the LORD.

verses.kjv: And I appeared unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob, by the name of God Almighty, but by my name JEHOVAH was I not known to them.
verses.web: I appeared to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, as God Almighty; but by my name LORD I was not known to them.
verses.ct: I appeared to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob as God Almighty, but I did not reveal myself to them by my name, the LORD.

verses.kjv: And I have also established my covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land of their pilgrimage, wherein they were strangers.
verses.web: I have also established my covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land of their travels, in which they lived as aliens.
verses.ct: I made a covenant with them, promising to give them the land of Canaan — the land where they lived as foreigners during their travels.

verses.kjv: And I have also heard the groaning of the children of Israel, whom the Egyptians keep in bondage; and I have remembered my covenant.
verses.web: Moreover I have heard the groaning of the children of Israel, whom the Egyptians keep in bondage, and I have remembered my covenant.
verses.ct: Now I have heard the groaning of the Israelites, whom the Egyptians have enslaved, and I have remembered my covenant.

verses.kjv: Wherefore say unto the children of Israel, I am the LORD, and I will bring you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians, and I will rid you out of their bondage, and I will redeem you with a stretched out arm, and with great judgments:
verses.web: Therefore tell the children of Israel, ‘I am LORD, and I will bring you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians, and I will rid you out of their bondage, and I will redeem you with an outstretched arm, and with great judgments.
verses.ct: So tell the Israelites this: 'I am the LORD. I will free you from the crushing labor the Egyptians have forced on you. I will rescue you from slavery. I will redeem you with my outstretched arm and with mighty acts of judgment.

verses.kjv: And I will take you to me for a people, and I will be to you a God: and ye shall know that I am the LORD your God, which bringeth you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians.
verses.web: I will take you to myself for a people. I will be your God; and you shall know that I am LORD your God, who brings you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians.
verses.ct: I will claim you as my own people, and I will be your God. Then you will know that I am the LORD your God, the one who freed you from the oppression of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And I will bring you in unto the land, concerning the which I did swear to give it to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob; and I will give it you for an heritage: I am the LORD.
verses.web: I will bring you into the land which I swore to give to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob; and I will give it to you for a heritage: I am LORD.’ ”
verses.ct: I will bring you into the land I swore to give to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. I will give it to you as your permanent possession. I am the LORD.'"

verses.kjv: And Moses spake so unto the children of Israel: but they hearkened not unto Moses for anguish of spirit, and for cruel bondage.
verses.web: Moses spoke so to the children of Israel, but they didn’t listen to Moses for anguish of spirit, and for cruel bondage.
verses.ct: Moses delivered this message to the Israelites, but they wouldn't listen to him. Their spirits were crushed by the brutal slavery they endured.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: Then the LORD spoke to Moses:

verses.kjv: Go in, speak unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, that he let the children of Israel go out of his land.
verses.web: “Go in, speak to Pharaoh king of Egypt, that he let the children of Israel go out of his land.”
verses.ct: "Go and tell Pharaoh, king of Egypt, to let the Israelites leave his land."

verses.kjv: And Moses spake before the LORD, saying, Behold, the children of Israel have not hearkened unto me; how then shall Pharaoh hear me, who am of uncircumcised lips?
verses.web: Moses spoke before LORD, saying, “Behold, the children of Israel haven’t listened to me. How then shall Pharaoh listen to me, when I have uncircumcised lips?”
verses.ct: But Moses protested to the LORD, "Look, the Israelites themselves won't even listen to me! Why would Pharaoh listen? I'm a terrible speaker."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, and gave them a charge unto the children of Israel, and unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt.
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, and gave them a command to the children of Israel, and to Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to both Moses and Aaron, giving them orders regarding the Israelites and Pharaoh, king of Egypt, to bring the Israelites out of Egypt.

verses.kjv: These be the heads of their fathers’ houses: The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel; Hanoch, and Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi: these be the families of Reuben.
verses.web: These are the heads of their fathers’ houses. The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel: Hanoch, and Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi; these are the families of Reuben.
verses.ct: Here are the leaders of the Israelite clans: The sons of Reuben, Israel's firstborn, were Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi. These were the families descended from Reuben.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Simeon; Jemuel, and Jamin, and Ohad, and Jachin, and Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanitish woman: these are the families of Simeon.
verses.web: The sons of Simeon: Jemuel, and Jamin, and Ohad, and Jachin, and Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanite woman; these are the families of Simeon.
verses.ct: The sons of Simeon were Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Shaul, whose mother was a Canaanite woman. These were the families descended from Simeon.

verses.kjv: And these are the names of the sons of Levi according to their generations; Gershon, and Kohath, and Merari: and the years of the life of Levi were an hundred thirty and seven years.
verses.web: These are the names of the sons of Levi according to their generations: Gershon, and Kohath, and Merari; and the years of the life of Levi were one hundred thirty-seven years.
verses.ct: Here are the sons of Levi listed by their family lines: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari. Levi lived to be 137 years old.

verses.kjv: The sons of Gershon; Libni, and Shimi, according to their families.
verses.web: The sons of Gershon: Libni and Shimei, according to their families.
verses.ct: The sons of Gershon, by their family lines, were Libni and Shimi.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Kohath; Amram, and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel: and the years of the life of Kohath were an hundred thirty and three years.
verses.web: The sons of Kohath: Amram, and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel; and the years of the life of Kohath were one hundred thirty-three years.
verses.ct: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel. Kohath lived to be 133 years old.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Merari; Mahali and Mushi: these are the families of Levi according to their generations.
verses.web: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their generations.
verses.ct: The sons of Merari were Mahali and Mushi. These were the family lines of Levi, listed by their generations.

verses.kjv: And Amram took him Jochebed his father’s sister to wife; and she bare him Aaron and Moses: and the years of the life of Amram were an hundred and thirty and seven years.
verses.web: Amram took Jochebed his father’s sister to himself as wife; and she bore him Aaron and Moses. The years of the life of Amram were one hundred thirty-seven years.
verses.ct: Amram married his father's sister Jochebed, and she gave birth to Aaron and Moses. Amram lived to be 137 years old.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Izhar; Korah, and Nepheg, and Zichri.
verses.web: The sons of Izhar: Korah, and Nepheg, and Zichri.
verses.ct: The sons of Izhar were Korah, Nepheg, and Zichri.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Uzziel; Mishael, and Elzaphan, and Zithri.
verses.web: The sons of Uzziel: Mishael, and Elzaphan, and Sithri.
verses.ct: The sons of Uzziel were Mishael, Elzaphan, and Zithri.

verses.kjv: And Aaron took him Elisheba, daughter of Amminadab, sister of Naashon, to wife; and she bare him Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.web: Aaron took Elisheba, the daughter of Amminadab, the sister of Nahshon, as his wife; and she bore him Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
verses.ct: Aaron married Elisheba, the daughter of Amminadab and sister of Naashon. She gave birth to Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Korah; Assir, and Elkanah, and Abiasaph: these are the families of the Korhites.
verses.web: The sons of Korah: Assir, and Elkanah, and Abiasaph; these are the families of the Korahites.
verses.ct: The sons of Korah were Assir, Elkanah, and Abiasaph. These were the families descended from Korah.

verses.kjv: And Eleazar Aaron’s son took him one of the daughters of Putiel to wife; and she bare him Phinehas: these are the heads of the fathers of the Levites according to their families.
verses.web: Eleazar Aaron’s son took one of the daughters of Putiel as his wife; and she bore him Phinehas. These are the heads of the fathers’ houses of the Levites according to their families.
verses.ct: Aaron's son Eleazar married one of the daughters of Putiel, and she gave birth to Phinehas. These were the leaders of the Levite families, listed by their family lines.

verses.kjv: These are that Aaron and Moses, to whom the LORD said, Bring out the children of Israel from the land of Egypt according to their armies.
verses.web: These are that Aaron and Moses to whom LORD said, “Bring out the children of Israel from the land of Egypt according to their armies.”
verses.ct: This Aaron and this Moses are the very ones the LORD commanded, "Bring the Israelites out of Egypt, organized by their tribal divisions."

verses.kjv: These are they which spake to Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring out the children of Israel from Egypt: these are that Moses and Aaron.
verses.web: These are those who spoke to Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring out the children of Israel from Egypt. These are that Moses and Aaron.
verses.ct: They are the ones who confronted Pharaoh, king of Egypt, demanding the release of the Israelites. This was Moses and Aaron.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the day when the LORD spake unto Moses in the land of Egypt,
verses.web: On the day when LORD spoke to Moses in the land of Egypt,
verses.ct: On the day the LORD spoke to Moses in the land of Egypt,

verses.kjv: That the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, I am the LORD: speak thou unto Pharaoh king of Egypt all that I say unto thee.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “I am LORD. Tell Pharaoh king of Egypt all that I tell you.”
verses.ct: the LORD said to him, "I am the LORD. Tell Pharaoh, king of Egypt, everything I say to you."

verses.kjv: And Moses said before the LORD, Behold, I am of uncircumcised lips, and how shall Pharaoh hearken unto me?
verses.web: Moses said before LORD, “Behold, I am of uncircumcised lips, and how shall Pharaoh listen to me?”
verses.ct: But Moses replied to the LORD, "I'm a terrible speaker — why would Pharaoh ever listen to me?"
